overview: This documentation plan is designed to guide developers through the 'Get-Started' project, which facilitates interactions with language models using Azure's GPT-based models. The project uses a multi-agent system to manage tasks and roles efficiently.

docs.title: Project Overview and Purpose
docs.description: This document provides a comprehensive overview of the 'Get-Started' project, explaining its purpose in facilitating structured interactions with Azure's GPT-based models through a multi-agent system.
docs.prerequisites: Basic understanding of language models and multi-agent systems.
docs.goal: To give developers a clear understanding of the project's objectives and high-level functionality.

docs.title: System Architecture and Design Decisions
docs.description: Detailed explanation of the system architecture, including key design decisions made during development. It covers the role of main scripts and configuration files.
docs.prerequisites: Familiarity with Python programming and YAML configuration files.
docs.goal: To help developers understand the structural organization and rationale behind architectural choices.

docs.title: Core Workflows and Data Flows
docs.description: This document describes the core workflows involving agents and tasks, including how data flows through the system from input to output.
docs.prerequisites: Understanding of system architecture and agent-based systems.
examples: Example of agent initialization and task execution.
docs.goal: To provide a detailed walkthrough of how tasks are processed within the multi-agent framework.

docs.title: High-Level Component Interactions
docs.description: Exploration of how different components such as LLM, Agent, Task, and Crew classes interact within the system.
examples: Code snippets demonstrating interactions between agents and tasks.
docs.goal: To illustrate the interplay between various components in accomplishing project goals.

docs.title: Getting Started Guide
docs.description: A step-by-step guide for setting up the development environment and running the initial scripts to interact with the language models.
docs.prerequisites: Access to Azure services and basic command line knowledge.
examples: Instructions for setting up environment variables and running '01-llm.py' script.
docs.goal: To enable developers to quickly start working with the project by providing initial setup instructions.

docs.title: Advanced Configuration and Customization
docs.description: Guide on customizing agent behaviors and task parameters using configuration files.
docs.prerequisites: Familiarity with YAML syntax and configuration management.
examples: Examples of modifying 'agents.yaml' and 'tasks.yaml' to alter agent roles and tasks.
docs.goal: To empower developers to tailor the system's functionality to their specific needs.
